title: Nine in critical condition after mass stabbing on UK train | ABC NEWS
description: Two men have been arrested after a mass stabbing on a passenger train in England's Cambridgeshire left ten people hospitalised, with nine in critical condition.  Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer called the incident "appalling" and urged residents to follow the authorities' advice. title: UK train stabbing leaves victims in hospital with life-threatening injuries, police say | ABC NEWS
description: Police and emergency crews have rushed to Huntingdon Station in the UK after reports of multiple stabbings on a train.  Two people have been arrested and armed police are at the scene.  Ten stabbing victims have been taken to hospital, nine of them with life-threatening injuries.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Are first home buyers schemes pricing Australians out further? | ABC NEWS
description: The federal government's expansion of the first-home buyers' 5 per cent deposit scheme may be increasing competition for entry-level properties.  Mount Gravatt in south Brisbane is one of many once-affordable suburbs that have quickly become out of reach for many potential buyers. title: Community support organisations struggling with growing demand | ABC NEWS
description: *Warning: This video contains discussions of suicide.*  Leesa Mountford co-founded mental health charity "I Got You" in memory of her son.  Organisations like hers in the ACT are struggling to meet demand for their services and more Canberrans are missing out.  If you or anyone you know needs help: Suicide Call Back Service on 1300 659 467 Lifeline on 13 11 14 Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander crisis support line 13YARN on 13 92 76 Kids Helpline on 1800 551 800 Beyond Blue on 1300 224 636 Headspace on 1800 650 890 ReachOut at au.reachout.com MensLine Australia on 1300 789 978 QLife 1800 184 527  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Millions to lose benefits as US government shutdown continues | ABC NEWS
description: The ongoing US government shutdown is affecting federally run services, including air traffic control and mail delivery, which are either closed or operated by unpaid workers.  Funds for monthly grocery stipends have also run out, impacting 42 million Americans who were due to receive their payments this past weekend. title: Trial of notifications for NSW domestic violence survivors | ABC NEWS
description: During a 12-month pilot program, 'DV Notify' will alert survivors of domestic and family violence when an alleged perpetrator is released from custody.
